intro: Galium mexicanum subsp. flexicum, commonly known as Mexican bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium mexicanum subsp. flexicum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
